latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.latestTitle: Internet of Things (IoT) Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2017

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.title: To provide minimal cybersecurity operational standards for Internet-connected devices purchased by Federal agencies, and for other purposes.
Internet of Things (IoT) Federal Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2018
Internet of Things (IoT) Federal Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2018
Internet of Things (IoT) Federal Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2018
item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

item.text:
Internet of Things (IoT) Federal Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2018

This bill requires Internet-connected devices purchased by federal agencies to meet specified security requirements.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Internet of Things (IoT) Federal Cybersecurity Improvement Act of 2018
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. KELLY of Illinois:H.R. 7283.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 18 of section 8 of article I of the Constitution[Page H10170]

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
